title: An experimental investigation into the feasibility of MIMO techniques within the HF band
abstractText: Multi-element antenna arrays have long been employed at receiver sites to obtain spatially separated samples of the incoming wavefield at a receiver which are then combined by a variety of techniques ranging from the simple to the complex to reduce the deleterious effects of multi-path fading. In recent years, the mobile radio community has been investigating techniques in which arrays of antennas are employed at both the transmitter and receiver (rather than just at the receiver as previously) with the aim of significantly increasing the data throughput capacity within a fixed bandwidth by exploiting the presence of multipath propagation. These are known as MIMO (multiple input / multiple output) systems. The aim of this proposed project is to undertake an experimentally based investigation on the potential applicability of MIMO techniques to communications within the HF band.
findingsText:
Multi-element antenna arrays have long been employed at receiver sites to obtain spatially separated samples of the incoming wavefield at a receiver which are then combined by a variety of techniques ranging from the simple to the complex to reduce the deleterious effects of multi-path fading. In recent years, the mobile radio community has been investigating techniques in which arrays of antennas are employed at both the transmitter and receiver (rather than just at the receiver as previously) with the aim of significantly increasing the data throughput capacity within a fixed bandwidth by exploiting the presence of multipath propagation. These are known as MIMO (multiple input / multiple output) systems. 



In collaboration with the University of Rennes 1, this project demonstrated the feasibility of MIMO technology in the HF band where increased capacity was demonstrated to be tenable for 4 by 4 antenna configurations. Novel colocated antenna arrays gave enhanced capacity gains which were comparable with spaced antenna arrays. A versatile 8 by 8 MIMO channel sounder was realised with future applications. A new partner, the Swedish Ministry of Defence, FOI, joined the project and contributed to the experimental programme. The application of this work is outside academia, with potential uses within defense organisations as well as for specialised communications systems. Title



Cognitive Multiple Antenna Access Technology for Over the Horizon Wireless Services
